feed.title: Category: Video Games | MECHAkunEX Media Diary

entry.title: Game: The Legend of Zelda: Link to the Past (SNES, 1991) (5)
entry.content:
Today we played for an hour and forty-five minutes. We got the third, fourth, and fifth crystals. We ended up doing about a third of the third dungeon to get it. Once we got the Titan's Mitt in the fourth dungeon, we got a few things around the world to power up before finishing the boss fight... including all four bottles.

Total time: 4:43

entry.title: Game: The Legend of Zelda: Link to the Past (SNES, 1991) (4)
entry.content:
We played for about two hours today. We got the second crystal and got to the final part of the third dungeon in the Dark World. In addition we did a bit of exploration and found some cool things in the world. I love this game. My son is really enjoying it too, although at about an hour and fifteen minutes he starts getting tired of it. I hope he'll play himself some day and I'll watch.

Total time: 2:57

entry.title: Game: Professor Layton and the Last Specter (DS, 2011) (6)
entry.content: I've got to the final battle. Every game ends in kind of the same way, but kind of totally different. It's wild.

entry.title: Game: Professor Layton and the Last Specter (DS, 2011) (5)
entry.content: During the last week I've been playing more than one puzzle a day because I want to empty my queue. Tonight I played for a little more two hours while watching YouTube videos. I did one of the marble jump puzzles on my first try, it was awesome.

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 13 2 (PS3, 2012) - DLC
entry.content: I wrote in my calendar to check on the DLC about six months after I beat the game, when presumably it would all have been released. It has. I looked for information about it and almost none of it seems interesting, except Lightning's episode. But, I found that it only takes about 25 minutes (including cut-scenes) and that's not worth 5 bucks, so I just watched it. The new ending is neat. I'm excited for 13-3. I love this battle system so much and I find the world to be really cool too. I hope it can be efficient for them to produce, make them lots of money, and make FF15 amazing.
